description: Shareholders' agreement tailored to Ghanaian private equity norms and the Companies Act, 2019.

clauses.clause_text: This Shareholders' Agreement is entered into on {{agreement_date}} among {{company_name}} (the 'Company') and the following shareholders: {{shareholder_list}}.

The Board shall consist of {{total_directors}} directors. {{shareholder_a}} shall be entitled to appoint {{directors_a}} directors, and {{shareholder_b}} shall be entitled to appoint {{directors_b}} directors.

If any Shareholder proposes to transfer any Shares to a third party, that Shareholder shall first offer such Shares to the other Shareholders on the same terms and conditions as the proposed transfer to the third party.

In the event of a proposed sale of a majority stake (defined as over {{control_threshold}}%) by a majority Shareholder, the minority Shareholders shall have the right to include their Shares in the sale on a pro-rata basis and on the same terms.

If Shareholders holding at least {{drag_threshold}}% of the Shares approve a sale of the Company to a bona fide third party, they shall have the right to require the other Shareholders to sell their Shares on the same terms and conditions.

Notwithstanding any other provision, the following matters shall require the prior written consent of {{veto_shareholder}}: (a) amendment of the Constitution; (b) increase or decrease in share capital; (c) entry into any transaction exceeding {{spending_limit}}; (d) appointment or removal of the Auditor.
The Company shall distribute at least {{dividend_percentage}}% of its annual audited net profit as dividends, subject to the solvency test requirements under Section 71 of Act 992.
This Agreement is governed by the laws of Ghana. Any dispute shall be referred to arbitration in Accra under the Alternative Dispute Resolution Act, 2010 (Act 798).
